Class FileBrowser

  • java.lang.Object
    • FileBrowser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class FileBrowser
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    FileBrowser allows a user to traverse the directory structure of all the drives available to a computer using a command line interface.
    Since:
    2013-11-10
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Pash DeVore

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.io.File currentDirectory
      Keeps track of user's current location.
      protected java.lang.String currentMask
      Used to regulate which file structures are visible.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FileBrowser()
      Creates a new instance of FileBrowser, setting the current directory to the user's home directory and the current file mask to '.*' (all files will be displayed).

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.io.File changeDirectoryDown(java.lang.String newDir)
      Attempts to change to a user specified directory.
      java.io.File changeDirectoryUp()
      Attempts to change the current directory to the current directory's parent.
      boolean changeDrive(java.lang.String newDriveName)
      Attempts to change the drive to the passed in drive name String.
      java.io.File getCurrentDirectory()
      Returns the current directory.
      java.util.Collection getDirectories()
      Returns a sorted Collection containing all subdirectories of the current directory.
      java.util.Collection getFiles()
      Returns a sorted Collection of files in the current directory.
      java.util.Collection getFiles(java.lang.String fileTypeMask)
      Returns a sorted Collection of files in the current directory with the passed in file type mask.
      java.util.Collection getRoots()
      Returns a sorted Collection of the root drives.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args) 
      void run()
      Run method which keeps track of any changes to the directory the user is currently in.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileBrowser

        public FileBrowser()
        Creates a new instance of FileBrowser, setting the current directory to the user's home directory and the current file mask to '.*' (all files will be displayed).

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static final void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • changeDirectoryDown

        public final java.io.File changeDirectoryDown(java.lang.String newDir)
        Attempts to change to a user specified directory. If the passed in directory name does not exist, the user is informed and the directory does not change. Otherwise, the new directory becomes the current directory.
        Parameters:
        newDir - A String referring to the new directory to which the user wishes to move.
        Returns:
        java.io.File The updated current directory.

      • changeDirectoryUp

        public final java.io.File changeDirectoryUp()
        Attempts to change the current directory to the current directory's parent. If the current directory does not have a parent then the directory remains unchanged.
        Returns:
        java.io.File The updated current directory

      • changeDrive

        public final boolean changeDrive(java.lang.String newDriveName)
        Attempts to change the drive to the passed in drive name String. If the passed in value does not match a drive name, nothing will happen. Otherwise, the currentDirectory is updated and set to the new drive root.
        Parameters:
        newDriveName - A String referring to the new drive where the current directory is to be set.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • getCurrentDirectory

        public final java.io.File getCurrentDirectory()
        Returns the current directory.
        Returns:
        java.io.File The currently active directory.

      • getDirectories

        public final java.util.Collection getDirectories()
        Returns a sorted Collection containing all subdirectories of the current directory.
        Returns:
        java.util.Collection A sorted Collection.

      • getFiles

        public final java.util.Collection getFiles()
        Returns a sorted Collection of files in the current directory.
        Returns:
        java.util.Collection A sorted Collection.

      • getFiles

        public final java.util.Collection getFiles(java.lang.String fileTypeMask)
        Returns a sorted Collection of files in the current directory with the passed in file type mask. If the user has not specified a file mask, the '.*' mask will be used and all files will be returned.
        Parameters:
        fileTypeMask - A String referring to the file structure to be masked.

      • getRoots

        public final java.util.Collection getRoots()
        Returns a sorted Collection of the root drives.
        Returns:
        java.util.Collection A sorted Collection.

      • run

        public final void run()
        Run method which keeps track of any changes to the directory the user is currently in.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
